alert.note: Alert for Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 10:01AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches inches possible, with accumulations of 2 to 4 feet locations above 4000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon and Ochoco- John Day Highlands. In Washington, Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest and Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
